_header: Saint Longinus was a blind knight tho God was I-do on the Rood
Subjects: saints’ lives; Longinus, saint, life of
_description: Life of Longinus in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Longius was a blind kniht þo God was don on þe
                    RoodePilatus him made vr lord stinge and oþur ek þat þer
                    stode…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now God for þe swete Merci þat þou hast seint
                    Longius i dofforȝif vs vre misdede her and bring vs to heuene also.
                    AMEN.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Longius was a blind knyght & þo crist was don on
                    rodePilat him made oure lord stynge oþere þat þer
                    stode…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Now god for þy mercy þat þu seint longius hast y
                    doforȝeue vs oure misdede her & bring vs to heuen also
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line
BodLauMis463.Editions:
Peebles,  Rose Jeffries. 
             The Legend of Longinus.
Bryn Mawr College Monograph Series
         9. Baltimore: Furst, 1911: 94-5.

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint Longius was a blind knyt þo god was don on rodePilatus
                    him made oure lord stynge & oþere þat þere
                    stode…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…God for þe swete grace þat for seint longius hath I
                    doffor ȝeue vs oure mys dede here and bringe vs to heuen
                    also

OxfCCC431.First Lines:
[S]eint longyn was a blind [sic] þo god was do on þe
                    ro[de]Pilatus him made oure lord stinge & oþer þat þere
                    stode…
OxfCCC431.Last Lines:
…Now god for þi swerde loue þat þow hast S longin
                    ydoforȝif vs oure misdede & bringe vs to heuene also
OxfCCC431.Note: Portion of text lost due to mutilation of leaves

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seint Longius was a blind kniȝt þo god was ido In
                    rodePilate him made oure louerd stinge & oþer þat þer
                    stode…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Nou god wor þe swete milce þat uor sein longius hast
                    idoffor ȝif us oure misdede here & bring us to heuene
                    also
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.84-85.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Longeus was a blynd kniȝt þo god was ydo on þe
                    rodePilatus him made stynge oure lord and oþere þat þer
                    stode…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now god ffor þe swete mercy þat to Seint Longeus hast
                    ydofforYif vs oure mysdede and bring vs to heuene also

CamStJohn28.First Lines:
Seynt longius was a blynd knyȝt þo god was on þe
                    rodePilat hym made oure lord to stynge & oþere þat þer
                    stoode…
CamStJohn28.Last Lines:
…now good lord for þi swete grace þat þu to seynt
                    longius hast dofor ȝeue vs alle oure mysdedes here & bryng vs to
                    heuene also
CamStJohn28.Note: In this MS incorporated as part of 3452

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint longius was a blynde knyȝt þo god was do on þe
                    rodepilatus made hym oure lord stynge & oþer þat þer
                    stode…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Now god for þe mylce þat þu hast seint longius i
                    dofor ȝeue ous oure mysdede & brynge ous to heuene
                    also

BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Now god for þe milce þat þu hast seint longius idoVor ȝiue vs oure misdede & bringe vs to heuene also

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seint Longius was a blynde knyght whan god was doun on rodePilat
                    him made our lord to stynge & oþer þat þer
                    stode…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now god for þe swete mercye þat þou for longius
                    hast doForȝeue vs our mysdede and bring vs to heven also.
                    Amen.
